sections.heading: control, defined.Common control means that the power to direct or cause the direction of the management and policies of a person or an organization by ownership of stock or voting rights, by contract, or otherwise is held by the same person or persons

sections.text:
71-7433.Common control, defined.

Common control means that the power to direct or cause the direction of the management and policies of a person or an organization by ownership of stock or voting rights, by contract, or otherwise is held by the same person or persons.

SourceLaws 1992, LB 1019, ยง 6;R.S.1943, (2003), ยง 71-7406;Laws 2006, LB 994, ยง 7.
